p: Safety. In traditional doses, there is no report on the toxicity of E. globulus. However, high doses can cause nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea ( WHO, 2002). In a preclinical assay of 1,8-cineol in mice, this compound was classified as presenting low toxicity ( Xu et al., 2014). However, high doses can cause nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea ( WHO, 2002). However, in the cited clinical trial, the essential oil and 1,8-cineol did not present a significant side effect. Overall, safety is High.
